intro: Dalechampia scandens var. hibiscoides, commonly known as the Hibiscoid Dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine, featuring heart-shaped leaves and yellowish-green flowers. Its botanical structure includes a distinct calyx and a single pistil, typical of many Euphorbiaceae species. It thrives in moist, sunny habitats and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
